timeline.bodyText: Point out that the upgrade tool will remove all files that having no resources, no matter whether they are complete tsfiles or in-merging files.
timeline.author: jixuan1989

replies.bodyText: eh... actually we won't remove level-0 tsfiles, even they may not have resources.. In this case, the log will guide users to  re-start 0.11 and run flush manually to seal those level-0 files.

timeline.bodyText:
this method begins from the position behind the marker, while the deserializeFrom(ByteBufer) begins from the position of the marker.
It is inconsistent and hard to maintain codes.
timeline.author: jixuan1989

replies.bodyText: Yes, but we can get that from the method signature, because this method pass the marker as a parameter. And, i will add some comments for these two methods

timeline.bodyText: what's the difference of using swtch-case
timeline.author: jixuan1989

timeline.bodyText:
e...  it is not equal with previous version:
public void encode(short value, ByteArrayOutputStream out) uses varint while this function does not.
timeline.author: jixuan1989

replies.bodyText: Previous version use encode(int value , ByteArrayOutputStream out) which in the previous version is not encode it as varInt. However, in the current version encode(int value , ByteArrayOutputStream out) encode the integer as a varInt, so the encode(float value, ByteArrayOutputStream out) can no longer call that method, because we don't want our float value become a varInt.
replies.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: why add statistics here?

replies.bodyText: If the chunk has only one page, the page won't have page statistics, while constructing page of this chunk, we need to pass the chunk's statistics to the page as its page statistics.

timeline.bodyText: It seems upgradeFolder has been created in line402.
timeline.author: jt2594838

timeline.bodyText: Remove this if it is truly unused.
timeline.author: jt2594838

replies.bodyText: removed
replies.author: HTHou

timeline.bodyText: Just to confirm, what if the storage group name contains a comma?
timeline.author: jt2594838

replies.bodyText:
Name of storage group can only be characters, numbers and underscores.
See https://iotdb.apache.org/UserGuide/Master/Concept/Data%20Model%20and%20Terminology.html
replies.author: HTHou

timeline.bodyText: It would be better to add a comment and explain why such data types need decoding.
timeline.author: jt2594838

replies.bodyText: Fixed
replies.author: HTHou

timeline.bodyText:
String.getBytes is a bit wasteful here as the conversion result is discarded immediately, but I think maybe you can make this method non-static and cache the returned byte[] in this object, and use it when serializeTo is called.
The same technique may be applied to other structures where string length is calculated before actually serialized.
timeline.author: jt2594838

replies.bodyText: Actually, the method is called only once in the contructor method. But you are right, this method shouldn't be a statis method, it should be a private and non-static method
replies.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: Better to use some final static fields to explain this. And is it really necessary to use the numbers from Marker? It is confusing when you have 1 and 4, but there are no 2 and 3.
timeline.author: jt2594838
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -33,101 +34,119 @@
 
 public class ChunkHeader {
 
+
+  /**
+   * 1 means this chunk has more than one page, so each page has its own page statistic 4 means this
+   * chunk has only one page, and this page has no page statistic
+   */
+  private byte chunkType;

timeline.bodyText: Better to wrap this in a more semantic way.

timeline.bodyText: where to check if the user uses Version 1 (i.e., version <0.10), then reject the upgrade.
timeline.author: jixuan1989

replies.bodyText:
This method is only called by load external TsFile module, which is no related with the upgrade.
When user uses version 1, we will check System.properties file to know the version, show the error logs and close the IoTDB server.
replies.author: HTHou
